algorithms.Privacy and protection of personal data:
Privacy-state = % of individuals manage access to personal data on the internet (3 months): at least one of I_MAPS_RPS, I_MAPS_RRGL, I_MAPS_LAP, I_MAPS_RAAD, I_MAPS_CWSC 
(as percentage of population and per country)
The above mentioned variables are: Individuals that manage access to personal data on the internet (3 months):
- read privacy policy statements before providing personal data
- restricted or refused access to the geographical location
- limited access to profile or content on social networking sites or shared online storage
- refused allowing the use of personal data for advertising purposes
- checked that the website where personal data provided was secure

weight=1/5
algorithms.Alignment with the CoE Convention on Cyb:
Alignment = Aweight1 (40%) * Alignment CETS 185 + Aweight2 (40%) * Alignment CETS 189 + Aweight3 (20%) * Alignment CETS 224
  Alignment CETS 185 
                      if country is not in the Chart of signatures and ratifications of Treaty 185 = 0 
                      elseif the date of ratification is blank = 15% 
                      elseif the date of entry into force is blank or in the future = 80%
                      else 100%
  Alignment CETS 189 
                      if country is not in the Chart of signatures and ratifications of Treaty 189 = 0 
                      elseif the date of ratification is blank = 15% 
                      elseif the date of entry into force is blank or in the future = 80%
                      else 100%
  Alignment CETS 224
    if country is not in the Chart of signatures and ratifications of Treaty 224 = 0 
     elseif the date of ratification is blank = 15% 
     elseif the date of entry into force is blank or in the future = 80%
     else 100%
Changes
The alignment to CETS 224 has been added with respect to the previous version for completeness. 
The Second Additional Protocol to the Convention on Cybercrime on enhanced co-operation and disclosure of electronic evidence (CETS No.224) provides a legal basis for disclosure of domain name registration information and for direct co-operation with service providers for subscriber information, effective means to obtain subscriber information and traffic data, immediate co-operation in emergencies, mutual assistance tools, as well as personal data protection safeguards
algorithms.% of organisations and enterprises perfo:
Eurostat’s ‘Security policy: measures, risk and staff awareness’ provides percentage of enterprises > 10 persons performing cybersecurity risk assessment. 

Indicator value= Eurostat value for percentage of organisations and enterprises performing cybersecurity risk assessment
algorithms.Cybersecurity (curricula) graduates in h:
Cybersecurity graduates in higher education = 
       Count of cybersecurity graduates in higher education curricula / Population in a country.
algorithms.Maturity of national level CSIRT(s):
Maturity level =
           0           if no SIM3 level
           WBasic if Basic level
           Winter  if Intermediate level
           Wadv    if Advanced level
           Wcert   if Certified-advanced against the highest SIM3 version that is available (version 2 now)
Weights
WBasic = 10%, Winter = 35%, Wadv = 80% Wcert = 100%
algorithms.Percentage of enterprises in a country c: Indicator value= Eurostat value for percentage of Enterprises having insurance against ICT security incidents
algorithms.Certified Business Continuity Management: Indicator = Number of sites per country certified for ISO 22301:2019 / number of enterprises per country

algorithms.OES resilience - cases:
OES resilience (year X) based on serious incident cases = 
            RANK (# of incident cases reported per 1 M citizens: high to low) / #EU MS
# of serious incident cases reported per 1 M citizens = 
             # of serious incident cases reported by country for year X / Population size (M)
algorithms.E-communications resilience (EECC) - cas:
e-communication resilience based on serious incident cases

Value = RANK (# of serious incident cases reported by citizen; high to low) / #EU MS

# of serious incident cases reported per citizen =  # of serious incident cases reported by country for year X / Population size

Source: ENISA Project - CIRAS
algorithms.E-communications resilience (EECC) - dur:
e-communication resilience based on serious outage times

Value = RANK (SUM(serious incident reported outage times) /citizens by country); high to low) / #EU MS

Source: ENISA Project - CIRAS
algorithms.E-trust services resilience (e-IDAS) - c:
e-trust services resilience  based on serious incident cases

Value = RANK (# serious of incident cases reported per QC for eSignatures issued; high to low) / #EU MS

# of serious incident cases reported per QC for eSignatures issued =  # of serious incident cases reported by country for year X / number of QC for eSignatures issued

Source: ENISA Project - CIRAS
algorithms.E-trust services resilience (e-IDAS) - d:
e-communication resilience based on serious outage times

Value = RANK (SUM(outage times) /citizens by country); high to low) / #EU MS

Source: ENISA Project - CIRAS
algorithms.National culture of cybersecurity:
Weighted values of multiple Eurobarometer variables = 
•	% of internet users who changed the way they use the internet due to security concerns 
•	% of internet users who feel very-well/well informed about the risks of cybercrime
•	% of internet users who are aware of the existence of a website, email address, online form, or contact number in their country where they can report a cybercrime or any other illegal online behaviour (e.g. cyberattack, online harassment or bullying)?
Weight: 1/3 for each variable
algorithms.Percentage of surveyed OES in a country: Indicator value= NIS Investment study value for percentage of Enterprises having a cyber insurance solution
algorithms.Cybersecurity Investments by surveyed OE: Indicator value= Average % per country of NIS investment study value for estimated IT budget/spending/ estimated Information Security budget
algorithms.National CSIRTs\u2019 Presence in the In: International presence of CSIRTs = #of CSIRT Teams member of FIRST in country/ Population size
algorithms.Enterprises ICT security measures:
Weighted values of 9 Eurobarometer variables =
•	Percentage of enterprises using strong password authentication
•	Percentage of enterprises keeping the software (including operating systems) up-to-date
•	Percentage of enterprises performing user identification and authentication via biometric methods implemented by the enterprise
•	Percentage of enterprises using encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails
•	Percentage of enterprises using data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud)
•	Percentage of enterprises using network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network)
•	Percentage of enterprises using VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network)
•	Percentage of enterprises maintaining log files for analysis after security incidents
•	Percentage of enterprises performing ICT security tests
Weight = 1/9 per variable

algorithms.Priority of CIIP in a country's NCSS:
Priority of CIIP in a country’s NCSS = NCAF level for objective 11 “Protect critical information infrastructure”

(Number of Yes in Level 1)/(Number of questions in Level 1)*1 + (Number of Yes in Level 2)/(Number of questions in Level 2)*2 + (Number of Yes in Level 3)/(Number of questions in Level 3)*3 + (Number of Yes in Level 4)/(Number of questions in Level 4)*4 + (Number of Yes in Level 5)/(Number of questions in Level 5)*5
algorithms.Implementation state of general cybersec:
Current Indicator/Algorithm: 
Transposition indicator = SUM(state of eligible Directive * weight)/TOTAL(number of eligible Directives)
    State of eligible (cybersecurity related parts of) Directive/Regulation[i] =
     100%  if the Directive is fully transposed (notification sent to the EC) and entered into force
       70%  when legislation has been transposed (notification sent to the EC), but entry into effect is in the future.
       40%  when national legislation partially covers Directive requirements, but full transposition is pending.
         0%  otherwise
		 
weight = 1/3
algorithms.Coverage of essential sector-specific cy: Transposition indicator =   SUM of sectors covered

algorithms.Enterprises: ICT security measures:
Weighted value of 8 Eurostat variables =
•	Share of enterprises using strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
•	ICT security measure used: combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
•	Share  of enterprises using encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
•	Share of enterprises using data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
•	Share of enterprises using network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
•	Share of enterprises using VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
•	Share of enterprises maintaining log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
•	Share of enterprises performing ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)
Weight = 1/8 per variable
algorithms.Privacy and protection of personal data::
Share of individuals that managed access to personal data on the internet by performing at least one of the following actions: 

• read privacy policy statements before providing personal data
• restricted or refused access to the geographical location
• limited access to profile or content on social networking sites or shared online storage
• refused allowing the use of personal data for advertising purposes
• checked that the website where personal data provided was secure

(Eurostat value for variable I_MAPS_5 corresponding to the % of individuals that manage access to personal data on the internet (3 months) by performing at least one of the following actions: I_MAPS_RPS, I_MAPS_RRGL, I_MAPS_LAP, I_MAPS_RAAD, I_MAPS_CWSC)
algorithms.SMEs: Staff Awareness:
Share of SMEs that make persons employed aware of their obligations in ICT security related issues  

Value = Value of variable E_SECAWANY 

Source: Eurostat - European Union survey on ICT usage in enterprises
algorithms.SMEs: ICT security measures:
Share of SMEs using at least one of the following ICT security measures: 
* 	Strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
* 	Combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
* 	Encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
* 	Data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
* 	Network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
* 	VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
* 	Maintainance of log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
* 	Performance of ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)


Value = Weighted value of 8 variables: E_SECMSPSW; E_SECMDUO; E_SECMDENC; E_SECMOSBU; E_SECMNAC; E_SECMVPN; E_SECMLOG; E_SECMTST
Weight = 1/8 per variable

Source: Eurostat - European Union survey on ICT usage in enterprises

algorithms.Alignment with the CoE Convention on Cyb:
Alignment = Aweight1 (40%) * Alignment CETS 185 + Aweight2 (40%) * Alignment CETS 189 + Aweight3 (20%) * Alignment CETS 224
 Alignment CETS 185 
If a country has signed AND ratified AND the convention has  entered into force date - 100%
else if a country has signed AND ratified - 80%
else if a country has signed - 15%
else 0  
Alignment CETS 189 
If a country has signed AND ratified AND the convention has  entered into force date - 100%
else if a country has signed AND ratified - 80%
else if a country has signed - 15%
else 0    Alignment CETS 224
If a country has signed AND ratified AND the convention has  entered into force date - 100%
else if a country has signed AND ratified - 80%
else if a country has signed - 15%
else 0  

Changes
The alignment to CETS 224 has been added with respect to the previous version for completeness. 
The Second Additional Protocol to the Convention on Cybercrime on enhanced co-operation and disclosure of electronic evidence (CETS No.224) provides a legal basis for disclosure of domain name registration information and for direct co-operation with service providers for subscriber information, effective means to obtain subscriber information and traffic data, immediate co-operation in emergencies, mutual assistance tools, as well as personal data protection safeguards
algorithms.Participation by essential and important: Value = SUM ( Score for Qx* ) / Maximum total score
algorithms.Large enterprises: ICT security measures:
Share of large enterprises using at least one of the following ICT security measures: 
* Strong password authentication (E_SECMSPSW)
* Combination of at least two authentication mechanisms (e.g. user-defined password, one-time password (OTP), code generated via a security token or received via a smartphone, biometric methods) (E_SECMDUO)
* Encryption techniques for data, documents or e-mails (E_SECMDENC)
* Data backup to a separate location (including backup to the cloud) (E_SECMOSBU)
* Network access control (management of access by devices and users to the enterprise's network) (E_SECMNAC)
* VPN (Virtual Private Network extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network) (E_SECMVPN)
* Maintainance of log files for analysis after security incidents (E_SECMLOG)
* Performance of ICT security tests (E_SECMTST)

Value = Weighted value of 8 variables (E_SECMSPSW; E_SECMDUO; E_SECMDENC; E_SECMOSBU; E_SECMNAC; E_SECMVPN; E_SECMLOG; E_SECMTST)
Weight = 1/8 per variable

Source: Eurostat - European Union survey on ICT usage in enterprises
